title: Egg in a Hole Recipe
description: Egg in a hole makes a hearty breakfast that's ready to eat in 5 minutes. A runny yolk egg cooked in the center of a piece of toast… Delicious!

4.7 (370) 312 Reviews 64 Photos Egg in the hole makes a delicious breakfast! A runny yolk egg cooked in the center of a piece of toast and eaten with a fork is a great way to enjoy an egg in a slightly different way. My kids feel fancy when eating these. Submitted by rosburn Updated on November 15, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 64 64 64 64 Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 1 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 1 ½ teaspoons bacon grease 1 slice bread 1 egg salt and ground black pepper to taste Directions Melt bacon grease in a nonstick pan over low heat. Cut a 2-inch hole in the center of bread slice; place in the hot skillet and cook until lightly toasted, about 2 minutes. Flip bread and crack egg into the hole; season with salt and pepper. Continue to cook until egg is cooked and mostly firm; flip again and cook 1 minute more. Serve immediately. I Made It Print 893 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Egg in a Hole 01 of 64 Photo by  Kevin Rising 02 of 64 Photo by  Art Beecher 03/01/2022 Delicious and fun.When I flipped it, I added a slice of rosemary ham (base) and American cheese (top). Didn't have any bacon grease so I used butter.Saved the circle of bread I removed with the mouth of a glass and after I make this again, will make a little sandwich with the two circles I removed.If you've never made it, give it a shot. 03 of 64 Photo by  SilverBoba1103 03/31/2020 04 of 64 Photo by  Daniel Ferrigno 02/28/2020 First time making it. Definitely a winner. 05 of 64 Photo by  Abraham Joel LeBlanc 02/28/2020 06 of 64 Photo by  Alyssa Crombag 12/07/2019 07 of 64 Photo by  Amanda Potter 10/26/2019 08 of 64 Photo by  Cassie Jones 07/22/2019 09 of 64 Photo by  PanJake 07/16/2019 10 of 64 Photo by  Michael Q 06/12/2019 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Shakshuka 410 Ratings Shakshooka 7 Ratings Mexican Huevos Rancheros 1 Rating Easy Money Breakfast Burritos 27 Ratings Southwest Breakfast Burritos 105 Ratings 23600 English Muffin Breakfast Pizzas 12 Ratings Avocado Breakfast Bowl 119 Ratings Egg in a Pepper 94 Ratings Cranberry-Orange Spiced Oatmeal 49 Ratings Egg Pesto Breakfast Wrap 27 Ratings Breakfast Egg Muffins 37 Ratings Poached Eggs Caprese 99 Ratings Steamed Egg (Chawan Mushi) 26 Ratings Light Fruit and Nut Granola 27 Ratings Eggs Benedict Breakfast Pizza 109 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: rosburn
instructions: Melt bacon grease in a nonstick pan over low heat.;Cut a 2-inch hole in the center of bread slice; place in the hot skillet and cook until lightly toasted, about 2 minutes. Flip bread and crack egg into the hole; season with salt and pepper. Continue to cook until egg is cooked and mostly firm; flip again and cook 1 minute more. Serve immediately.
